moa.classifiers.core.splitcriteria

Class GHDSplitCriterion

  • java.lang.Object
    • AbstractOptionHandler
      • moa.classifiers.core.splitcriteria.GHDSplitCriterion

  • public class GHDSplitCriterion
extends AbstractOptionHandler
    Implementation of the Hellinger Distance as a decision tree split criterion as described in "Learning Decision Trees for Unbalanced Data", Cieslak and Chawla, 2008 and "Hellinger distance decision trees are robust and skew-insensitive", Cieslak et al., 2012. This split criterion is to be used on imbalanced data sets.
    Version:
    1.0, 10/30/13
    Author:
    Rob Lyon

    • Method Detail

      • getMeritOfSplit

        public double getMeritOfSplit(double[] preSplitDist,
                              double[][] postSplitDists)
        Computes the merit of splitting for a given distribution before the split and after it. For instance, given a two class input distribution this function will determine the entropy of the pre-split distribution, minus the entropy of splitting this distribution according to some attribute. Example: preSplitDist = {100,200} where 100 is the number of instances belonging to class zero and 200 is the number of instances belonging to class one. postSplitDists = { {25,75} , {150,50} } | | v v First branch Second branch To be clear, postSplitDists[0] contains the distribution for the first branch and postSplitDists[1] contains the distribution for the second branch. Then postSplitDists[0][0] contains the number of class zero instances at the first branch and postSplitDists[0][1] is the number of class one instances at the first branch (defined similarly for the other branch).
        Parameters:
        preSplitDist - the distribution before the split. For two class case preSplitDist will contain two elements where preSplitDist[0] contains the number of class zero instances and preSplitDist[1] contains the number of class one instances.
        postSplitDists - the distribution after the split.

      • computeHellinger

        public static double computeHellinger(double[][] dist)
        Hellinger distance as used by Cieslak and Chawla.
        Parameters:
        dist - the distribution of instances.
        Returns:
        the helllinger distance between them.

      • computeHellinger

        public static double computeHellinger(double P_mean,
                                      double P_variance,
                                      double Q_mean,
                                      double Q_variance)
        Computes the Hellinger distance between two normal distributions P and Q. The function used is: H(P,Q)= 1 - SQRT( 2 * standard deviation of P * standard deviation of Q / variance of P + variance of Q) * e^{ -1/4 * ( (mean of P - mean of Q)^{2} / variance of P + variance of Q)}
        Parameters:
        P_mean - the mean of the positive distribution.
        P_variance - the variance of the positive distribution.
        Q_mean - the mean of the negative distribution.
        Q_variance - the variance of the negative distribution.
        Returns:
        the Hellinger distance for the given class distribution.
